Web forms are used by an adnministrator to allow the capturing of information entered by site users and saving it to a file, saving it to the database, emailing it to a person, or all three.

 

To create a Web Form:

 

Add the Web Form portlet to a page:

  • From the "Add" menu add a Web Form portlet to your page.
  • In the Web Form portlet, select the configuration (wrench) icon, then select 'Configuration".

Configure the form information:

  • In the "Form Information" section of the Web Form configuration screen, give your form a title, and optionally a description.

Configure the form handling:

  • In the "Handling of Form" section of the Web Form configuration screen, check one or more of the "Send as Email", "Save to File", or "Save to Database" boxes.
  • Enter any additional information as needed.

Configure the form fields:

  • In the "Form Fields" section of the Web Form configuration screen you will notice that the form comes pre-configured with Name, Rating, and Comments form fields. The "+" and "-" (plus and minus) buttons on the right side of the screen are used to add or delete form fields.
  • Press a "+" button, you will notice that a new field has been added.
  • In the "Name" box give the new field a name.
  • In the "Type" list, select a type for the new field, e.g. "Text".
  • If the field will not be required to be filled in by the user, check the "Optional" box.
  • Notice that the field has a "Validation" link. Click the link to view the validation options.
  • Continue to use the "+" button to add as many fields as desired.
  • When you are finished adding fields, press the "Save" button to save the Web Form.
